alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 2:14PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bath and southeastern Greenbrier Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 214 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Neola, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewisburg... Renick... Warm Springs... Neola... Hot Springs... Falling Spring... and Lake Moomaw. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southwestern and west central Virginia...and southeastern West Virginia.
